And I don't know where she's getting advice from. But the president now, does he want to make more calls to widows? I would think now anytime he makes a call, is it going to be recorded? Is someone going to be snooping? Is going to be exploited for political purposes?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

Never saw border agents Ramos on ABC News. So they're very selective with who they use. I just think Congressman Wilson, what's the purpose of going public with this condolence call?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

And she had trouble pronouncing the name of one of the FBI agents. So, you know, for her to go around and turn around and say that Donald Trump did the same thing I think is completely unfair.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: She also tweeted. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: . tragedy that was being exploited as a conspiracy to hurt Hillary and Obama. OK. So, she just needs to get her story straight before she.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think -- I have such a strongly different view on this one. But I would start with this, Jesse. First and foremost.

utterances.sentences: Well, let me just say, you're right about this, Kimberly. It's a serious topic right now in Washington. People don't know what happened in Niger. utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I want to find those answers too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK, fine. So, the second thing to say though, and this is about Frederica Wilson, the congresswoman from Florida, Donald Trump's chief of staff Kelly, is that Kelly was wrong on two scores. First of all, clearly, the president did say that your husband knew what he was getting into. And it did cause the window and the mother to get upset and cry. That's just not good. And then, secondly, here comes Kelly calling Frederica Wilson an empty barrel and saying that she took credit for something that she didn't do, which was to raise funding for a new FBI headquarters in Miramar, Florida. Turns out there's a video, and the video shows that she did no such thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, I saw the transcript of what she said, and she was tooting her own horn.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't care about that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: . what Kelly said. And so, Kelly comes across as having becoming an enabler for Trump and just covering for him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's a good point, but so does she, the congresswoman, because she was in the car with the grieving family and they've played it on the speaker phone.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I do think there was another way for the congresswoman to express this. And that would have been to privately call the White House and ask to speak to General Kelly and tell him I just want to let you know the widow was upset when the president said this. And I think it would be good for you to tell the president that, so that in the future, he has more information because he's going to make more of these calls. If that call was not returned or not taken, then maybe you go decide to go to the public. But there's another way to do it. Plus, remember, that these children are going to grow up and be able to read all of this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.sentences: OK. So, like, let's just stop it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I love when you do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

But it reveals that they're seeing Niger as a shameless political albatross to hang around Trump's neck, rather than trying to figure out what happened to four slain heroes. With Benghazi, it was a terror attack that was blamed on a video.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. Thank you for that. Next, a new twist in the Russia Collusion probe. Robert Mueller now reportedly looking into a family member of one of Hillary Clinton's top aides. Coming up. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Special Counsel Robert Mueller isn't just looking into the Trump campaign ties to Russia. Guess what? He's now reportedly investigating the brother of Hillary Clinton's former campaign chair John Podesta. Tony Podesta and his Democratic lobbying firm are now in the cross hairs following an inquiry into the finances of former Trump campaign chair Paul Manafort. There's a federal criminal inquiry now into whether Podesta's firm violated the foreign agents registration act. Meanwhile, the president just addressed whether he's been advised to meet with Mueller himself in the Russian probe.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I mean, nobody's asked me to do that. There is no collusion. I can tell you that. Everybody is saying that. You know, you have senate meetings, you have senate hearings, and nobody has asked us to do interviews anywhere. They have found no collusion. In fact, the other side even admits it. They come out of these hearings whether it's senate, or whether it's the house, and they say is a collusion. Everyone looks like there's no collusion.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So Kimberly, the firm, the Podesta group is being looked at because Paul Manafort is accused of not registering under this act.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So seems like this is a problem in Washington. The Podesta group was also getting paid by a Kremlin backed group of Ukrainian fighters. And they also just happened to not actually register under this act. So now they're saying they're trying to register, make sure they're fully compliant, but now they're muddied into these waters too.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, right. And so, you can't treat them differently. That's hypocritical. It's a double standard. And the time frame is 2012 to 2014, and there are some crossovers there. So, OK, let's do a full Russia collusion investigation there. I mean, if that's what you want to do, let's just take a look at all of it because they're both trying to go back to fully comply and register properly to comport with the law and that act to try to clean it up. But, obviously, they're also looking at Manafort with something else. He might have some other information to be able to give them. He may have some other financial misdealing that they're trying to hook him on. But the whole headline, you know, towards the end of the OCR, and Trump, and collusion, and everyone that was working with him, just really awful. You know, if you go back and look at what was said, and the damage done, and the things that were printed that were outright lies.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Juan, do you think this looks bad for the people that are close to the Clintons?

utterances.sentences: It's their firm.

utterances.sentences: I know. It's John's firm. John Podesta owns the...

utterances.sentences: Tony Podesta.

utterances.sentences: Right. And then he didn't register under this act that you were talking about, Dana, but then substantively or retroactively tried to register which is legal. But nonetheless, I think it's caught the attention of Bob Mueller. Because what was going on there would seem to be that the U.S. -- U.S. lobbyists were not only making a ton of money. I mean, this was big money. That's why you had six people feeding at the trough. But this is another example of how Russia gets involved in American government.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And The Hill newspaper also, Greg, today said that the Russians were trying to find a way to mess with Hillary Clinton all the way back in 2009. That's when she was, you know, hitting the reset button.

If the media -- in the media landscape, if you salivate over collusion but you dismiss these stories, that's the exposure. That's what this story shows.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Like a black light?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A black light. It shows the bias. And the same thing goes for the uranium story. The problem with this story, not as juicy, because two sentences in, it's a little kind of tedious. The lessons about corruption is if you want to get away with it, make it boring. You know, don't steal diamonds. Steal influence.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: PERINO

She didn't do it. Loretta Lynch is now in the crosshairs. Comey may have illegally leaked. So -- Susan Rice story hasn't been corroborated. So, you know, when all the dust settles, it's funny who's actually -- may be criminal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Especially when you look at P.R. firms and lobbying firms in D.C. Who were more than willing to take money from the Russians. Let's think about that. All right. The Kate Steinle murder trial began today in San Francisco. The details straight ahead on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: A jury began hearing opening statements this morning in the case that set off a national debate on immigration, specifically on sanctuary cities. The Kate Steinle murder suspect went to trial today. Jose Zarate is an illegal immigrant who was deported five times before he allegedly killed 32-year-old Steinle in 2015. He was let back into the country by San Francisco, which grants safe haven to illegals. Short after Kate was gunned down down, I flew across the country to confront the city's board of supervisors.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The city of San Francisco let this guy out. Even though the feds said hold him. I'm here to find out why you guys did that. Because this sanctuary city policy that you guys still support is costing lives. You know what Kate said? Her last words. Look at the picture, guys. You guys aren't even looking. Look at the picture. You afraid? I know it's tough. Her last words were "Help me." Help me. Why aren't you guys helping her?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. So Kimberly, you're familiar with the politics of San Francisco.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Intimately.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You could see more Kate Steinles; yet the board would not do anything about sanctuary city policies.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: There's such a -- you know, with all due respect, but such a built-in, baked-in liberal bias. And you know, I saw it firsthand, not only as first lady but as, you know, a prosecutor and assistant district attorney in San Francisco just in the course. Even trying to get a true identification of an individual. They would fight you tooth and nail. No one was complying with ICE detainers. Extremely frustrating. See a revolving door of people coming in and going back out again. In county jail for two or three days, and then being released back out. You know, just criminal recidivism abounds. And so this was just such a senseless, you know, loss of life that could have been prevented just by administrations and officials and bureaucracies following the law, adhering to the law that's on the books. But it seems that public safety fell to second place at the expense of a really proactive policy on immigration as it relates to illegal criminal aliens.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And Kimberly makes the point, Greg, that it was a preventable tragedy. And the media still does not want to touch this story. You have a beautiful young woman. You have Trump involved in the story, the city of San Francisco, political corruption. This guy was deported five times. He was a felon. You would think this would be on the news constantly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Especially, too, when you think about, if you look on a different issue like gun control and the way the media has been spending a lot of time clamoring for more laws. We need more laws. There's suddenly law and order about gun control. And this case has proved that, you how, you had existing laws that weren't enforced. And if you had enforced the laws, she would have been alive. So how can you ignore that fact while clamoring for more laws for guns, arguably laws that wouldn't have stopped anything? But here -- here is law. Consistently, you should say, "Boy, they should enforce this law, because this law is on the books." If you're going to feel strongly about gun control, how can you not feel strongly about this? Because it's still about law and order. The one interesting thing that I'm wondering is how this is going to pan out. Because I've been reading up on this, about whether they find out that this was an accident. And if they -- and how is that going to play out if they find out -- because they talk about the bullet. The bullet has kind of a dent in it, which means that it was ricocheted. So what does that mean? I mean, does that mean that it wasn't -- that it's not...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Guess what? It doesn't matter. Because the law will not provide an excuse for that, to say, "I didn't intend to kill you. It ricocheted." "I was shooting it. I purposely discharged it." And they transfer intent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right, because I think this was a weapon that was stolen...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: ... from a law enforcement officer's car. And this illegal immigrant...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's what the judge said. The judge says that is immaterial as to where the gun originally came from. It's just how the gun was used. What was its intended purpose? The gun was discharging...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And the other part -- the other part is you can't consider immigration status. That's not the issue here. The issue is whether or not -- he's charged with second-degree murder, Jesse. Right? And then the -- his lawyers are saying this was an accident. The gun was stolen from a U.S. Bureau of Land Management agent, from his car. We don't know how Zarate got the gun. But now the focus is on, so was this involuntary manslaughter or an accident, in which case he should be acquitted? Or maybe even is it a matter of mental illness or drug use, in which case you have a whole 'nother set of issues. But to me, you guys are complaining about so-called liberal media. I think mainstream media, let's say -- let's put it that way. Mainstream media not covering it. And I think, boy, as I recall, it was conservative media attacking immigrants, especially illegal immigrants, who made this a cause celebre, because they said, "Well, we're going to hold this up, and we're going to attack those immigrants." And I just don't see it as that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We're not attacking immigrants, Juan. We're saying that the city of San Francisco...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Attacking criminals.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: ... should never have allowed him in the city, because he had five felonies. He should have been deported.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think the federal government sent him there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Excuse me?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The federal government had arrested him. He had served some time. They then sent him to San Francisco.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He was deported five times, and he kept getting arrested in San Francisco; and they never told ICE about him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: They sent him back to San Francisco on a marijuana charge, as I understand it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, now it's going to be a -- sanctuary city.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He had numerous charges, one of which was marijuana. He also had a harder narcotics problem.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The only thing I would add, so there's six men and six women in the jury. And it's interesting to me that this is how juries usually end up. Just a range of people from a flight attendant, software engineer, a nurse, a marketing accountant, and a health economist. So these people, it's a jury of his peers that will decide his fate, guilty or innocent, and then I guess the judge probably decides the sentencing, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not -- that is not his peers. That's a funny thing about -- is that a jury of his peers?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's how our system is. They say the trial will last four to six weeks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Peers would be illegal aliens.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Change of venue.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right. You can find plenty of those in San Francisco.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wait. That's going to be their next point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They're going to file a lawsuit, that that's not their peers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I wouldn't be surprised.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They'll appeal it on that, and lack of change of venue, that it was improper. He was unable to get a fair trial due to the media coverage there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wait for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: On a lighter note, it is the biggest concert of the year. The Super Bowl LII halftime show headliner has been selected. The reveal and our thoughts up next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Cool song. So the rumors are true. Justin Timberlake confirming he will headline this year's halftime at Super Bowl LII in a very creative announcement alongside his pal, Jimmy Fallon.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Interesting.

utterances.speaker: JUSTIN TIMBERLAKE, MUSICIAN
utterances.sentences: Excuse me, sir. Do you have the time? JIMMY FALLON, HOST, NBC'S "THE TONIGHT SHOW WITH JIMMY FALLON": I was going to ask you, sir. Do you have the time?

utterances.speaker: TIMBERLAKE
utterances.sentences: I do have the time.

utterances.speaker: FALLON
utterances.sentences: You do halftime?

utterances.speaker: TIMBERLAKE
utterances.sentences: I do have time.

utterances.speaker: FALLON
utterances.sentences: You do halftime?

utterances.speaker: TIMBERLAKE
utterances.sentences: I do halftime.

utterances.speaker: FALLON
utterances.sentences: You do halftime?

utterances.speaker: TIMBERLAKE
utterances.sentences: I do halftime!

utterances.speaker: FALLON
utterances.sentences: You're doing the halftime show at the Super Bowl? Yes, you doing halftime! You're doing the halftime!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Justin swears this time, though, there won't be a mal -- a wardrobe malfunction. You may remember, his first halftime duo with Janet Jackson caused quite a storm a decade ago. So I think this will be his third time. He was there with 'N Sync. Then Janet Jackson. So three times.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I can't think of anything I'm less interested in then who is at the halftime. I don't care. I don't care about Justin Timberlake. I don't care about Super Bowl halftime. I believe that's when it all started to fall apart, was when they took a sport and they turned it into a spectacle. They felt that they -- they felt compelled to take something that people want to watch for entertainment; and they turned it into something celebrity driven. And I would just sit there and I'd go, "This is so not fun." And it used to be fun. Now -- and then so it's no surprise that it turned into politics.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What if there's kneeling?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know. That's what they...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: During the song or performance.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If he doesn't go out and kneel, he's going to get a lot of crap for it. You're supposed to be watching football for the sport. It's not to enlighten you. It's not Occupy Wall Street; it's NFL. I'm done with it. Done.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana, so one of the things that people are talking about is, in fact, that Janet Jackson has never been invited back. And the rumor is that she is banned from Super Bowl halftimes. Although the league says that's not true. But she was disinvited from a Grammy appearance and the like. And people say, well how come she gets all this blame but not the guy?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, isn't it typical?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think it's unfair but not surprising.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I will say that I think Broncos fans are really going to enjoy when they're cheering on their team at the Super Bowl, and they watch Justin Timberlake. It's going to be great.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: In Minneapolis, because you are a Broncos fan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Do you realize how bad they Broncos are, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Now, they're really -- they're coming back, and Juan has got the colors on today to prove it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: There you go. You never know.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Channeling a little Elway.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: A little Elway. A little Dana Perino right here. So you're a real fan. You love this sport, but here comes now Greg saying, "You know, it's become too political." I mean, wasn't it Beyonce with the fist and the black leather? And seemed to be delivering a message there. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Only non-football fans care about the halftime show. That's when all the people get up and they get excited.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They're at their party.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The people who actually don't watch football, they are there for the commercials and for the halftime show. I could -- I could care less about the halftime show.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You like the (UNINTELLIGIBLE).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm going to be watching my Eagles at the Super Bowl. So I'm probably going to be taking a bathroom break, probably restocking all my snacks.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wings.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And wings.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Probably getting beaten up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, no. So...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Excuse me. You want reality? The reality is, your children, I think you have...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wait, you're a Redskins fan. Right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm a Washington football team fan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh! You don't even say the name of your own team, Juan?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Where have you been?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We have a game tonight. You want to play a solo wager?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, because I think that -- I think your Eagles should win.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'll take that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. Kimberly...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Come to me again.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: A moment ago you just said that Janet Jackson, you think, came out on the bad end of this deal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And even Timberlake says she got 90 percent of the blame...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He only got 10 percent.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Listen, we can do a dramatic reenactment here, and I'll show you that he is equally culpable.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I think -- I think we'll avoid this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Who's Timberlake?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, but it's true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: The two of them did the performance together. They both knew, but yet, he's back again. Very unfair. Sad!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Go.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. "One More Thing" up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's time for "One More Thing." Let's do this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Greg's Shoppers News.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There's nothing better than shopping for pigs and pugs. As you'll see here, a woman was shopping in Florida. She was shocking up on her pork and she also had a -- over here, she found a pug in aisle nine, which is pugs. Aisle eight is pigs. Aisle nine is pugs.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: How did she had room to buy anything? The whole thing's full.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know. And then she realized she forgot her purse and just left them there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Maybe they ate it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Anyway.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That was cute.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK. I was fascinated. I had so many questions about that. Anyway, I wanted to give a shout out to B and C Magazine. That's the broadcasting and cable news people. Last week, hey had their 15th Annual Hispanic Television Summit here in New York and invited me on a panel to discuss modern media and young Hispanics. I was joined by fellow journalists from Buzzfeed, ABC News and CNN. Everybody's ratings are up these days, from broadcast to cable to social media. But the biggest jump: Hispanic news consumption. So it was fascinating to hear about the strides Hispanic media is making and the industry's interest in them.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Didn't I do this with you last year?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, you did.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And they didn't ask me back?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's roll this along. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. So Jesse is going to love this one. So French President Emmanuel Macron. He had -- his dog made quite a splash at the Elysee Palace. So they're at a meeting. They have a dog named Nemo. And all of a sudden, the dog actually took a leak on the fireplace.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's what we call "wee-wee."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That was great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He's a rescue. They rescued him in August. And so they were still working on the palace training.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Is rescue what used to be a pound dog?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Something like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. Thank you so much. OK, this is super, super, super cute. So a 9-year-old sends the president $3 and gets a letter back in return. Eli'sha was very concerned -- Davies, from Tennessee -- because he heard from his parents that President Trump was only going to take a salary of $1. And he is like, "How is this going to be?" Take a listen. ELI'SHA DAVIES, SENT $3 TO TRUMP: How is he going to eat or drink or, you know, pay if he needs to pay for his bills -- water bill or anything?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So back in January, Eli'sha sent him the three bucks. He got the letter back -- he was very excited -- including the $3. Oh, my God. To make a difference in his community and to think big and dream even bigger. So he reinvested.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My friend runs the correspondence office.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, wow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Does a good job.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: A good job.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I didn't name her. I didn't drop her name.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, you're really important.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Drop it like it's hot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have people -- I know people that do important stuff, too.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Like what?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesse. Jesse is important.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We'll see. So all of the five former presidents living were raising money for the hurricane relief over the weekend. And there they were. They raised, I think, over $33 million, which was quite incredible. But there was a funny moment during President Clinton's speech between W. and Obama. Roll it.

utterances.speaker: BILL CLINTON, FORMER PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: It can be a new beginning if we just do what we ought to do.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I mean, something's not right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There goes W. cracking a joke. Obama's laughing, and he's looking to see if Obama is -- there he is. Peeking. Did he find it funny? Yes, he did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There's something on Bill's back. That's what it is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Obama is trying not to laugh. A "kick me" sign?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly. Well, I was -- yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Or something.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We'll just leave it at that. Set your DVRs. Never miss an episode of "The Five." "Special Report" is up next. Content and Programming Copyright 2017 Fox News Network, LLC.
